channel.title: network plus course on simeononsecurity
channel.description: Recent content in network plus course on simeononsecurity

item.title: Network Plus Course: Wireless Security and IoT Access
item.dc:creator: SimeonOnSecurity
item.category: "CompTIA Network Plus Certification Exam" , "Wireless Security" , "IoT Access" , "MAC Filtering" , "Antenna Placement" , "Power Levels" , "Client Isolation" , "Guest Network Isolation" , "Preshared Keys" , "EAP" , "Geofencing" , "Captive Portal" , "IoT Security" , "Wireless Networks" , "Cybersecurity" , "IT Certification" , "Networking Fundamentals" , "Information Technology" , "Online Learning" , "Professional Development"
item.description: Enhance your knowledge of wireless security and IoT access with this comprehensive Network+ course. Learn about MAC filtering, antenna placement, power level configuration, preshared keys, EAP, geofencing, and IoT device security.

item.title: Network Plus Course: Backup and Restore for Network Stability and Resilience
item.dc:creator: SimeonOnSecurity
item.category: "IT Certification" , "Networking" , "Network Infrastructure" , "Backup and Restore" , "Disaster Recovery" , "High Availability" , "Data Protection" , "IT Resilience" , "Network Management" , "IT Operations"
item.description: Learn the importance of network device backup and restore, strategies for backing up and restoring device state and configuration, recovery sites, redundancy and high availability mechanisms, and essential metrics in network operations.

item.title: Network Plus Course: Cellular Technologies and Wireless Communication
item.dc:creator: SimeonOnSecurity
item.category: "CompTIA Network Plus Certification Exam" , "Cellular Technologies" , "Wireless Communication" , "CDMA" , "GSM" , "LTE" , "3G" , "4G" , "5G" , "MIMO" , "MU-MIMO" , "Advancements in Cellular Networks" , "Implications of Cellular Networks"
item.description: Explore cellular technologies like CDMA, GSM, LTE, 3G, 4G, and 5G, along with the concepts of MIMO and MU-MIMO in wireless communication, and analyze the advancements and implications of cellular networks.
